title: Indian Wells: Britain's Cameron Norrie through to quarter-finals with straight set win
description: British number one Cameron Norrie is through to the Indian Wells quarter-finals after a straight sets win over Russian Audrey Rublev.

title: Euro 2024 qualifiers: New Wales captain Aaron Ramsey wants to reach 100 caps
description: Wales boss Rob Page says Aaron Ramsey's desire to join Wales' 100-cap club has influenced his decision to continue his international career.

title: Porto 0-0 Inter Milan (0-1 on agg): Italian side move into Champions League quarter-finals
description: Inter Milan move into the Champions League quarter-finals for the first time since 2011 as they eliminate Porto in their last-16 tie.

title: SNP candidates predict independence in five years
description: Ash Regan, Humza Yousaf and Kate Forbes were speaking as they faced each other in a BBC Scotland TV debate.

title: Manchester City 7-0 RB Leipzig (8-1 agg): Erling Haaland scores five as City cruise into quarter-finals
description: Erling Haaland scores five as Manchester City thrash RB Leipzig to reach the quarter-finals of the Champions League.

title: John Caldwell : Tenth arrest over Omagh police shooting
description: A 45-year-old man is arrested in Belfast in connection to the attempted murder of Det Ch Inspc John Caldwell.

title: Budget: Jeremy Hunt to announce expansion of free childcare support
description: A scheme providing 30 hours of free childcare is expected to be expanded to cover one and two-year-olds in the Budget.

title: US drone crash: A moment fraught with danger
description: The encounter between a Russian jet and a US drone raises some difficult questions for President Biden.

title: Cladding: Michael Gove names firms yet to sign post-Grenfell fire safety contract

description: Undisputed super-middleweight champion Saul 'Canelo' Alvarez will defend his belts against Britain's John Ryder on 6 May in Mexico.

description: Constitution Hill is hailed as the "horse of a generation" after his breathtaking Champion Hurdle victory at Cheltenham.
